overview: Contemporary software systems such as search engines must deal with huge amounts of data, often in real time. In such cases, standard data structures and algorithms do not scale. This subject aims to provide an overview of contemporary advanced algorithms and data structures in computer science for such problems. These techniques serve as building blocks for solving complex algorithmic problems, and have many practical applications.
intended learning outcomes: Design, manipulate and reason about a variety of advanced algorithmic techniques and principles, and advanced data structures
Identify the appropriate algorithm (and data structure) to solve a complex problem
Implement such algorithms and data structures efficiently and correctly

alternate pre-requisite: Admission into or selection of one of the following:
Admission into or selection of one of the following:
Software specialisation (formal) in the MC-ENG Master of Engineering
Admission into one of the following:
Admission into the GD-CS Graduate Diploma in Computer Science

assessments.description: Two assignments:   written assignment due in week 4 (10%) and programming assignment due in week  11 (20%). Addressing Intended Learning Outcomes (ILO's) 1, 2 & 3.. 35 hours (of work required). Hurdle requirement:. Students must achieve 15/30 in total for the assignment work.

Written examination, 3 hours, due end of semester (60%). Addressing ILO's 1, 2 & 3.. 3 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must get 35/70 for the mid-semester test and end-of-semester written examination combined.

Mid-Semester test, 30 minutes, week 7 (10%). Addressing ILO's 1 & 2.. 30 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. Students must get 35/70 for the mid-semester test and end-of-semester written examination combined.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 36 hours, comprising one  2-hour lecture and one 1-hour tutorial per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Subject notes: This subject will be delivered through a combination of lectures and tutorials. Weekly exercises (with separate solutions) will be provided to students to consolidate their understanding on the subject contents.

Entry requirements including prerequisites may apply. Please refer to theCAP applications pagefor further information.
